Result: The respondent contested his surrender on the basis that:- (1) Correspondence did not exist between the offences in relation to which his surrender was sought and offences in this jurisdiction; and (2) His fundamental rights would not be respected if he were surrendered, particularly his right not to be subjected to inhuman or degrading treatment and his right to a private and family life. The Judge accepted the second of these points and refused to surrender the respondent to Moldova.

Title: O'Reilly -v- National Document Management Group LTD & Anor
Defendant: National Document Management Group LTD & Anor

Result: The respondent contested his surrender on the basis that he has the benefit of the decision in The Minister for Justice, Equality and Law Reform v. Machaczka [2012] IEHC 434. Judge Edwards refused to surrender the respondent as it would have breached his right to a private and family life as protected by Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights and section 37 of the European Arrest Warrant Act, 2003. In the alternative he, submitted that the application amounted to an abuse of process. While not alleging any lack of bona fides or misconduct on the part of the authorities, the Judge held that a cumulation of factors meant that the proceedings amounted to an abuse of process, and so refused to surrender the respondent to Poland.
Title: Minister for Justice -v- Machaczka

Result: Third-party notice set aside on grounds of delay.
Title: Purcell -v- Coras Iompair Eireann (CIE) & Ors

Result: "The time limit in s. 955 (2) of the Taxes Consolidation Act, 1997, was disapplied by s. 811 (5A) of the 1997 Act and therefore the Notice of Opinion was not out of time. However, the transaction was not a 'tax avoidance transaction' as it had availed of the relief provided by s. 31 TCA and the tax advantage had arisen, not by using s. 31 for a purpose other than for which it had been enacted, but by reason of the operation of s. 549 TCA, which was a specific anti-avoidance provision. Consequently, there was no misuse or abuse of s. 31 TCA."
Title: Hanrahan -v- Revenue Commissioners

Result: Relief sought refused
Title: Connolly -v- O'Dwyer Solicitors LLP
